result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Titus Singh

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Titus Singh appeared by video.  Attorney Helmi Hamad appeared by video for Titus Singh.  Prosecuting attorney Brad Alan Vorpahl in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt. 
Case scheduled for final review hearing. Defendant has yet to complete community service. State has no objection to allow defendant time to complete. Case adjourned for another final review hearing by Zoom, Branch 17.
Review hearing scheduled for November 15, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Titus Singh in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant has made all office contacts. Defendant in compliance with the terms of the agreement. Case adjourned to Branch 17.  Review hearing scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 10:40 am.
Received and Filed. DPA Supervision Report - 8.5.2022

Defendant Titus Singh (via Zoom) in court with attorney Helmi Hamad (in person).  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Titus Singh appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI
Defendant attended 6 out of 7 office contacts. Defendant needs to complete community service. Defendant needs to test negative in order to receive the benefit of this agreement. Defendant working on treatment. Defendant to establish treatment before the next court date. Defendant is semi compliant.  Case adjourned for Review Hearing.   Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to branch 17, Judge Carolina Stark, in Room 310 of the Safety Building.  Review hearing scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 10:20 am.
Received and Filed. DPA Court Report 07.01.22

As a condition of bail, court order the defendant may not possess dangerous weapons or firearms or apply for a conceal carry permit.
 Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.

Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Complaint/Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.
 
Court ordered case adjourned for Review in Branch 21.

Defendant Titus Singh in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI
  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defense waived reading and momentarily enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of client.  Review hearing scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Received and Filed, Addendum to Plea form
Received and Filed, Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Plea Advisement Form
